test.runs

Class ExactRun

  • java.lang.Object
    • test.runs.ExactRun
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Run
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ErrorRun, NoOutputRun

    public class ExactRun
extends java.lang.Object
implements Run
    A test run for exact matching. For each expected call to Terminal.printLine, one matcher has to be provided. If n matchers are provided and the tested class fails to call Terminal.printLine exactly n times, the run is considered to have failed.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Joshua Gleitze

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExactRun

        public ExactRun(java.lang.String command,
        java.util.List<org.hamcrest.Matcher<java.lang.String>> expectedOutputMatchers)
        Creates a run for the given parameters. A description of the expected output will automatically be created based on expectedOutputMatchers.
        Parameters:
        command - The command to run.
        expectedOutputMatchers - The matchers for the expected output. One matcher per expected call to Terminal.printLine.

        expectedOutputMatchers - The matchers for the expected output. One matcher per expected call to Terminal.printLine.

    • Method Detail

      • check

        public void check(java.lang.String[] testedClassOutput,
         java.lang.String errorMessage)
        Description copied from interface: Run
        Checks whether the output of the tested class does fulfil the needs defined by this run. Throws an exception if it doesn't.
        Specified by:
        check in interface Run
        Parameters:
        testedClassOutput - The output of the tested class for this run. One String represents one call to Terminal.printLine.
        errorMessage - The message that will be reported to Assert.fail(String) or Assert.assertThat(String, Object, org.hamcrest.Matcher)

      • getCommand

        public java.lang.String getCommand()
        Specified by:
        getCommand in interface Run
        Returns:
        The command that is to be run on the interactive console for this test run.

      • getExpectedDescription

        public java.lang.String getExpectedDescription()
        Specified by:
        getExpectedDescription in interface Run
        Returns:
        A String describing what this test run expects the tested class to print.
